comments.commentBody: How long are we willing to be pusillanimous and putrescent in the face of the Chinese onslaught against America. A school yard Bully never backs off unless punched in the nose. So, the choice is clear. Be gutless, sub-serviant to these Chinese who are ripping us apart and stabbing us at every turn OR Stand Up to them. They need us more thatn we need them. A sligth jolt to the Chinese economy may send these Commies over the cliff and the chaos that would ensue in China would make them wish they had been more fair and honest with America; the hand that fed them. I fully support Donald trump and I belive the Chinese are spooked.
This is not going to turn out well...

Trump won among college educated Whites.
I'm still trying to figure this out. His behavior seemed rational and acceptable at the time? How about now?
Still bewildered.
The president-elect doesn't do policy or analysis. He does whims conditioned by a lifetime in real estate.

Try as I migt to understand why it is acceptable,  even permitted for a person who is not our president to make statements on TWITTER which roil our country,  if no the world,  and yet it is not all right for me to do the same.  I am as much a citizen off this country as he , although I am aware that he will be president and I won't,  but still I need a refresher on  how many presidents we have at one time.  Is there no way to halt this very dangerous game?

I have to disagree

The idea that any national leadership, let alone the large and rational Chinese leadership, would think that the US is "mean" or "insulting" is silly.

Leaders will do what is prudent for their countries. Except for Obama, who seems to have a different agenda.

So let's see what is prudent for America with regard to China:
1) A South China sea with equitable access.
2) A reasonable balance of trade and currency trading
3) North Korea, China's proxy state, treats its people well and is not a threat to the rest of the world and the US
4) The people of Taiwan and Hong Kong, vibrant and culturally rich beacons in East Asia enjoy freedoms.
5) Cooperation in combatting Islamic terror threats
6) Environmental change and equitable access to Energy resources

Now let's look at the results
1) Look at a map of China's claims in this energy rich region, they are far from China and close to other countries. China stole American property in international waters
2) Ouch
3) A nation prison, close to being able to deliver a nuclear strike to Wash DC, NY and California
4) Fail
5) Only within Chinese borders, the US and Europe be damned.
6) The South China sea is an energy grab. China produces far more carbon emissions than the US, and the agreement allows China to increase emissions while the US decreases them. China is aggressively securing rights to energy resources worldwide.

Time to rethink our approach with China. Trump is correct

We read about Nero and Caligula of Roman empire,
but now we have their reincarnation in president elect.
He is good for late night shows but a disaster for the
country. Hope lies in the check and balance system.
Congress should do its job to constrain Mr. Caligula.

This is just another example of how thoughtless Trump will be as president and he hasn't even taken the oath of office yet. Judging by his goofy twits he shows no early example that he will even understand the enormous responsibility that oath's obligation implies to lead America in the best interests of it people.
He will be surrounded by a bunch of self-serving sycophants who will tell him only what he wants to hear. His dim witted voters hypnotized by a empty promises to make them feel good about themselves will still defend him no matter how destructive he is to their welfare.

When will the serious media stop with statements like these "t’s unclear ... if he (trump) understands the threat that a breakdown in relations would pose...Or maybe he understands and just doesn’t care."

I think that we should all accept now that it is the second one that prevails: he understands and just doesn’t care

The media will keep losing our confidence if they still give him free passes by stating that maybe he does not know...

I just checked. Our cumulative trade deficit with China under the Obama administration is approaching 2.5 trillion dollars at the finish line. That is a lot of money. Basically, 100 Mexican walls. We are clocking at about one wall per month. So there are serious issues here. China needs to open its markets. We can't have them produce these enormous foreign exchange surpluses and have their corporations and individuals use them to buy up our factories, real estate and technology. This is clearly not in our national interest.

We also need to protect East Asia from Chinese intimidation. China is rapidly approaching global economic parity with the United States. They may approach military parity over the next 20 years. China must be contained but not threatened or antagonized. We do need a cooperative relationship with China as well as I might, Russia and Iran. Trump's concerns about China are valid. His methods as they seem to be unfolding may be questionable.
Correction! China is only the US second largest trading partner. Do you know the first? Has been for a long time.

December 23, 2016

T S Eliot - “Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.”

D Trump will dictate as follows:
I dare to the world to counter the American Greatness -to rule for every minute from my first four years.
And who really knows what decisions will gain the true glory for the ruling by elite Republicans: that has given all earth the power for gamesmanship in the brand name of TRUMP forever ……
Soon come and visit my new Trump Towers in every nation worthy certified by Trump University dedicated for the New and Improved International World Order.

jja Manhattan, N. Y.

The Biggest challenge of our time is not lack of access to education (esp. 4 western world in MOOC era of EDX, Coursera etc.), it is sadly Ignorance, Stupidity & the Inability to #AskTheRightQuestion.

In our super connected (physical+informational+digital+economical ) world, the disconnect of cultural understanding & politician's like TrumpElect's previous peddling of racial/demographic/nationalism/ xenophobic hatred whilst ignoring human's existential risk is the biggest folly.

2017 will never be a zero sum era, especially if people exhibit Gorilla Silverbacks' Chest beating and ground thumping behaviour.

The Real danger for our world is illustrated perfectly in the brilliant DocuFilm by John Pilger http://thecomingwarmovie.com/,as once Nuclear nukes flies, it will not be the end of one nation but the World! Apparently we will NOT see the sun again for 1-3yrs (10yrs for fruit to grow again). Climate changed!

China will not push the button first as can be seen by the constraint shown the return of the drone. UNLIKE the USA/west, despite not having the universal form of democracy west pushing China 'to' adopt (Must Read book by Francis Fukuyama's book on why might not work).

Good Chinese emperors exhibited moral duty (if they have mandate from heaven) & take cautious & long term views, with hidden threats of harsh Nine familial exterminations 誅九族 sentence by next dynasty. Sadly Trump is not afraid of anything/anyone now and world will have to sadly accept the consequences
Since   Tramp   changes   his  mind   every  other   day,  what  is   said   today   will   be     different    tomorrow.
Wow, that was fantastic!  What an interesting life and family.

In view of all of Trump's provocations....and deliberate attention getting
tweets...which is unbalancing our foreign offices world wide: I say that
this irresponsibility is........TREASON....and it would be better to indict this
irresponsible maniac for treason...before he is inaugurated rather than have
the Department of Justice do this when a catastrophe caused by the loose
rhetoric of this insane man....cause a war ....

Trump is a very dangerous man...and the sooner the NYTimes makes this
statement the better...for the entire world at large.

One theme that inspires Mr. Trump's supporters is the view that the USA needs to fight back against other nations' not playing fair with us in the sandbox.  They forget we are also in that sandbox and we are not innocent bystanders who are unreasonably  being mistreated here.  We invaded Iraq under false pretenses and our overthrow of that regime would result in the open embrace of Democracy.  We interfere in the affairs of other nations to get "our" preferred leadership in office.  And we make deals with other regimes that benefit us at their own people's expense. They do the same.  To Trump and his supporters ALL that matters is winning.  Well sorry to inform you bullying and manipulating others has consequences.  For us as well as them.  That's why you have to consider your actions and your tweets BEFORE you implement them.

Perhaps the NYT overstates the Chinese "Power".

Status quo (Thanks to Nixon/Kissinger) has achieved nothing - The last 8 years of trying not to "offend or Anger China", has merely resulted in repeated acts of Chinese Belligerence.

Time to try a different approach - For every Boeing order that is cancelled, the Chinese economy stands to lost more. If a concerted effort is made to isolate China on Trade, they will keel down in a hurry.

Time to shake things up and force the Chinese into less belligerent positions. As for Armed conflict, if the quality of Chinese made products serves as a benchmark, Chinese made arms/armaments are NOTHING to worry about :)
Hillary won by almost 3 million votes. Trump's name should always be written as President Trump*
Oh Hollow Man, thou punch-drunk wrecking ball out to shatter our very foundation, not with your tweet but a nuclear bang.

The issue is not whether Trump is right or wrong. The issue is whether foreign policy should be declared by tweets. My hunch is that the total amount of thought that Trump has given to anything is the amount of time it takes to write a tweet.

To all of the readers who write long comments defending Trump. Although i usually disagree with you, I commend you for giving more thought to what you write than Trump does. But doesn't that frighten you just a little?
Buckle up! If, as has been suggested, Donald Trump listens to the last person he spoke to and loopy General Michael Flynn has his ear,  we could be in for a bumpy ride.

The NYTimes editorial board ended this Opinion piece by pointing out that Trump is ". . . a disrupter, no matter the consequences on American security."  Also, no matter the consequences on our economy.  The informed American public has known for a long time just how dangerous Trump might be to our security AND to our economy.  He is uninformed and MIGHT rely on a few trusted agents, many of whom are as aggressive and pugilistic as he is.  Trump seems to have no clue as to the delicate balances we have regarding Russia, China, Iran, North Korea and the Middle East.  Managing these delicate balances is not at all like he may manage his businesses and his business relationships.  Even if he keeps his (short) fingers off the nuclear button, his words alone are likely to wreak havoc and possibly worse during the next 4-8 years.  Frightening.

December 23, 2016
T S Eliot -
“Do I dare
Disturb the universe?
In a minute there is time
For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse.”

D Trump will dictate as follows:
I dare the world to counter the American Greatness to rule for every minute of my first four years and who really knows what decisions will gain the true glory for the ruling elite Republicans that has given all earth the power for gamesmanship in the brand name of TRUMP forever …… Come and visit my new Trump Tower in every nation worthy of polarity to be certified by Trump University for the New and Improved International World Order.

jja Manhattan, N. Y.
(Self educated by loyal reading of the New York Times )

replies.commentBody:
China has reasons.

Does anybody here care?

Even know what those reasons are?

Willing to make a deal to trade what they want for what we want?

China made its reasons clear when in 1951 it entered the Korean War. Those still apply. America and its proxies are not welcome on the Yalu border of China. That is worth a war with the US. It is worth allowing N Korea to antagonize the US.

China now has the additional reason of fear of refugees from a N Korea collapse. We don't care, but they do. See Europe, which cares very much about Syrian refugees in far lesser numbers than would flow out from a N Korean collapse.

We can make real offers on these issues. We have not. Just the opposite, our think tanks delight in what China sees as worst case.

We want China to fix our problem with N Korea, and to do so out of the goodness of their hearts just because we would like it, just because we define it as important. Not going to happen.

We don't do things for those reasons either, doing major expensive things because others want it, because others see it as more important than we do, without regard for our own major wants.

comments.commentBody:
Now wait a minute. China could stop cooperating by "refusing to help curb North Korea’s nuclear program"??? What is China doing to curb North Korea's nuclear program? Certainly they SHOULD be doing something, but are they? They should completely STOP North Korea's nuclear program. North Korea exists only because of China.

And what about China's stealing patents and copyrighted material and hacking US corporate computers to steal trade secrets? What about their manipulating their currency to cause unfair trade. What about their unfairly subsidizing industries that compete the ours?

China is eating our lunch. I am no diplomat, but what IS the status of Taiwan? We are selling them weapons to defend themselves, but we don't recognize their right to exist???

Perhaps it is time for some undiplomatic diplomats like Mr. Trump and Mr. Tillerson to start managing our relationship with China.
